Description: Neck and part of the upper body a Chian transport amphora of pink pottery. One of the handles between the neck and shoulder is complete but the other one is broken off short at the bottom. The exterior bears an incised five-pointed star at the top of the shoulder. A broken piece of the jar has been re-attached with a modern copper staple. The mouth is sealed with plaster bearing the impressed nomen of Amasis. There are a total of 16 impressions (including partial ones), but they were not all applied in the same sealing operation, as some have been applied above others on a secondary layer of plaster. Parts of three impressions from the first level can be seen.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 18 has been scratched into the side of the object. See also Cairo, EM, JE 27391; Oxford, AM, 1887.2506. Chian transport amphorae are attested all over Egypt. Being studied as part of PhD by Elisabeth Greifenstein (University of Wuerzburg).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 51 § 49, p. 58, 59 § 57, p. 71 § 67, p. 72 § 69, p. 109, pl. xxxvi, 5)
Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (2788, p. 292, nr 2788.)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 296)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.46, p.68-69, p.97, p.112, p.119, p.128, p.129, p.182, pl.24, p.210, p.222, pl.64)
Exhibition history: 2011 Mar-Oct, Dumwich Museum, The Dunwich Seal 2022 21 Jun-31 Oct, Marseille, MUCEM Museum of European and Mediterranean Civilisations, Pharaoh Superstars 2022-2023 24 Nov-6 Mar, Lisbon, Calouste Gulbenkian Museum, Pharaoh Superstars
